result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Scott Avery

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Randy Scott Avery in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Randy Scott Avery.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls 22CF288 and 22CF354. In both files, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Notes there has been receipt of proposal from the State, would like time to make counter offer. State is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Randy Scott Avery in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Randy Scott Avery.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Hoffman- Client will waive prelim
Court accepts waiver, defendant is bound over for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Randy Scott Avery appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Randy Scott Avery.  Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received complaint, waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. State requests $2,000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with S L N-W. Defendant has an open case with same victim on cash bail. Defendant has one failure to appear and a probation violation. Attorney Hoffman states local resident with family local asks for 1,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 cash bail with condition of no contact with S L N-W. Court quashes warrant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
